p: Both DENV and ZIKV may infect the central nervous system through a hematogenous route by crossing the BBB facilitated by the inflammatory response and permeability increase [ 116]. Although the exact pathway through which a flavivirus invades the CNS remains unclear, the complex interaction between virus and host immune response serves as the basis to neuropathogenesis, as demonstrated in other flavivirus infections, such as Japanese encephalitis virus (JEV) and WNV [ 76]. Identifying such cases is a crucial tool to understand the broad clinical spectrum of common and unusual arboviruses and their public health impact.
